This current spiral is just your nervous system adjusting to uncertainty, which makes sense because uncertainty *is* uncomfortable, even when it's the right move.

The "what if I can't find anything else" fear—that's worth acknowledging without letting it run the show. You *will* find something else. The question is when and what, and not knowing that yet is hard to sit with. But not knowing isn't the same as it not existing.

One thing that might help when the money spiral kicks in at night: try the same naming technique, but add one more step. "My brain is doing the money spiral." Then ask it: "Is there anything I can actually do about this *right now*, at 2am?" The answer is almost always no. **Your mom:** She reached out twice, didn't bring up the sensitivity comment, and is now asking to meet in person. That feels different than her usual pattern—or at least, it's an effort.
